auth_token.description: Authentication token to authenticate to the Unleash API

environment.description: The environment the token will have access to. Use `"*"` for all environments. By default, it will have access to all environments.

projects.description: The project(s) the token will have access to. Use `["*"]` for all projects. By default, it will have access to all projects.

type.description: The type of the API token. Can be `client`, `admin` or `frontend`

block.description: Provides a resource for managing unleash api tokens.

archive_on_destroy.description: Whether to archive the feature toggle on destroy. Default is `true`. When `false`, it will permanently delete the feature toggle.

project_id.description: The feature will be created in the given project

weight.description: Variant weight. Only considered when the `weight_type` is `fix`. It is calculated automatically if the `weight_type` is `variable`.

weight_type.description: Variant weight type. The weight type can be `fix` or `variable`. Default is `variable`.

block.description: Overrides existing context field values. Values are comma separated e.g `v1, v2, ...`)
Variant payload. The type of the payload can be `string`, `json` or `csv`
Feature variant
Provides a resource for managing unleash features.

enabled.description: Whether the feature is on/off in the provided environment. Default is `true` (on).

environment.description: The environment where the toggle will be enabled

project_id.description: The unleash project the feature is in

block.description: Provides a resource for enabling a feature toggle in the given environment. This can be only done after the feature toggle has at least one strategy.

archive_on_destroy.description: Whether to archive the feature toggle on destroy. Default is `true`. When `false`, it will permanently delete the feature toggle.

project_id.description: The feature will be created in the given project

enabled.description: Whether the feature is on/off in the environment. Default is `true` (on)

parameters.description: Strategy parameters. All the values need to informed as strings.

inverted.description: If constraint expressions will be negated, meaning that they get their opposite value.

value.description: Value to use in the evaluation of the constraint. Applies only to `DATE_`, `NUM_` and `SEMVER_` operators.

values.description: List of values to use in the evaluation of the constraint. Applies to all operators, except `DATE_`, `NUM_` and `SEMVER_`.

block.description: Strategy constraint
Strategy to add in the environment
Use this to enable a feature in an environment and add strategies
Tag to add to the feature

weight.description: Variant weight. Only considered when the `weight_type` is `fix`. It is calculated automatically if the `weight_type` is `variable`.

weight_type.description: Variant weight type. The weight type can be `fix` or `variable`. Default is `variable`.

block.description: Overrides existing context field values. Values are comma separated e.g `v1, v2, ...`)
Variant payload. The type of the payload can be `string`, `json` or `csv`
Feature variant
(Experimental) Provides a resource for managing unleash features with variants and environment strategies all in a single resource.

environment.description: The environment where the strategy will take place

feature_name.description: Feature name to assign the strategy to

parameters.description: Strategy parameters. All the values need to informed as strings.

project_id.description: The unleash project the feature is in

block.description: Provides a resource for add strategy to a feature toggle in the given environment.

email_sent.description: Whether the welcome email was successfully sent to the user.

invite_link.description: The link for the login link.

root_role.description: The role to assign to the user. Can be `Admin`, `Editor` or `Viewer`

send_email.description: Whether to send a welcome email with a login link to the user or not. Defaults to `true`.

block.description: Provides a resource for managing unleash users.
Retrieves a single api token based on provided filters. It raises an error if more than one token is returned.
Retrieves existing api tokens. Filters are optional.

archived.description: Wether the feature toggle is archived or not

created_at.description: The date the feature toggle was created

description.description: The description of the feature toggle

environments.description: The environments of the feature toggle

project_id.description: The project id of the feature toggle

stale.description: Wether the feature toggle is stale or not

type.description: The type of the feature toggle

block.description: Retrieve details of an existing feature

description.description: The description of the feature type

lifetime_days.description: The lifetime of the feature type in days

type_id.description: The id of the feature type

block.description: Retrieve details of an existing feature type

description.description: The description of the unleash project

environments.description: The list of unleash environments in this project

project_id.description: The project id of the unleash project

updated_at.description: The date the unleash project was last updated

block.description: Retrieve details of an existing unleash project

created_at.description: The date of creation of the user.

id.description: Id used to search the user.

block.description: Retrieve details of an existing user

query.description: Query used to search the user. It searches by `email`, `username` and `name` fields of users.

users.description: Collection of users that match the provided query.

block.description: Retrieve a collection of users that match the provided query.
